Path Utility module

path_util.construct_solution(predecessors, current_node, state_grid, score, algorithm, path_problem, fast_mode, goal_pos, goal_part)

Constructs a solution based on given parameters.

Parameters

  • state_grid¶ (State) – State grid with applied solution path

  • current_node¶ (Pos) – Last visited node in search.

  • predecessors¶ (Predecessors) – All visited predecessors.

  • score¶ (float) – The final solution score.

  • algorithm¶ (str) – Algorithm used in prior search.

  • path_problem¶ (PathProblem) –

  • fast_mode¶ (bool) – See fast_mode

  • goal_pos¶ (Pos) – The reached goal position.

  • goal_part¶ (int) – Part that should be appended to reach actual goal position.

Returns

Solution

path_util.get_corner_neighbors(direction, available_parts)

Returns all the neighbors that are allowed as the next move by the currently available corner parts.

Parameters

  • direction¶ (Pos) – Considered direction for fitting

  • available_parts¶( – obj:list [int]): See pipe_stock_check()

Returns

obj`Nodes<type_aliases.Node>`.

Return type

A set of neighbor

path_util.get_pipe_neighbors(direction, available_parts, at_start, transition)

Returns all neighbors that are allowed as the next move by the currently available pipe parts

Parameters

  • direction¶ (Pos) – Considered direction for pipe.

  • available_parts¶ (list [int]) – See pipe_stock_check()

  • at_start¶ (bool) – If the current position is the start point.

  • transition¶ (tuple [Pos, Pos]) – See get_transition()

Returns

A set of neighbor Nodes.

path_util.get_changed_nodes(predecessor_pos, current_pos)

Returns all nodes that have changed after a move.

Parameters

  • predecessor_pos¶ (Pos) – Node position opf the predecessor to the current node position.

  • current_pos¶ (Pos) – The currently expanded node position.

Returns

tuple [Node]

path_util.pipe_stock_check(part_stock, predecessors, fast_mode, key)

Calculates availability of parts.

Parameters

  • part_stock¶ (PartStock) – To the current path reduced part stock.

  • predecessors¶ (Predecessors) – See Predecessors

  • fast_mode¶ (bool) – See fast_mode

  • key¶ – See key

Returns

set containing the part IDs (int) left in stock.

path_util.get_available_parts(part_stock)

Returns available part IDs as set.

Parameters

part_stock¶ (PartStock) – To the current path reduced part stock.

Returns

set [int]

path_util.get_transition(pos, direction, transition_points)

Checks if transition points lie in the node in direction of the given node position.

Returns

tuple [Pos, Pos] if transition point found, else None.
